articles.description: All the latest football news, plus reaction to Chelsea's win over Newscastle and build-up to Arsenal v Porto in the Champions League.
articles.title: Football latest: Reaction to Chelsea's win & Champions League build-up

articles.description: World number one Novak Djokovic is beaten by 20-year-old lucky loser Luca Nardi in the third round at Indian Wells.
articles.title: Indian Wells: Novak Djokovic knocked out by lucky loser Luca Nardi

articles.description: After inspiring Chelsea to victory against Newcastle in the Premier League, will Cole Palmer force his way into England's Euro 2024 squad?
articles.title: Will 'class' Palmer force way into England Euros squad?

articles.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu loses in straights sets to Belarusian world number two Aryna Sabalenka in the third round at Indian Wells.
articles.title: Indian Wells: Britain's Emma Raducanu beaten by second seed Aryna Sabalenka

articles.description: India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant is declared fit to play in this month's Indian Premier League after a 14-month absence from cricket.
articles.title: Pant declared fit for IPL return after 2022 car crash

articles.description: BBC Sport's chief F1 writer Andrew Benson answers your questions following the Saudi Arabian GP at the weekend.
articles.title: F1 Q&A: Andrew Benson answers your questions after Saudi Arabian GP

articles.description: Racing's showpiece Cheltenham Festival starts on Tuesday with Irish trainer Willie Mullins set to dominate at the four-day meeting.
articles.title: Cheltenham Festival 2024: Preview as Willie Mullins runs State Man in Champion Hurdle

articles.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his latest Team of the Week?
articles.title: Who could be 'worth every penny?' Garth Crooks' Team of the Week

articles.description: Manchester United will face holders Chelsea - a repeat of last season's final - in the Women's FA Cup semi-finals, while Tottenham are drawn against Leicester.
articles.title: Man Utd face Chelsea in Women's FA Cup semi-final

articles.description: Cristiano Ronaldo's Al-Nassr are knocked out of the Asian Champions League in a quarter-final penalty shootout loss to Al-Ain.
articles.title: Ronaldo's Al-Nassr lose in Asian Champions League
